description_long: P: Therapist provided psycho-education (e.g., directive education about the traumatice vent, normal reactions to trauma, etc.; education to instill hope)
description_html:
P: Therapist provided psycho-education (e.g., directive education about the traumatic
event, normal reactions to trauma, etc.; education to instill hope)

description_long: General info re: abuse, trauma; specific info re: trauma child experienced (GE) and the child's reactions to his/her personal experience of the trauma
description_html:
General info re: abuse, trauma; specific info re: trauma child experienced (GE)
and the child's reactions to his/her personal experience of the trauma

description_long: Common emotional, behavioral, and physiological responses.
description_html: Common emotional, behavioral, and physiological responses.

description_long: Info about child's symptoms and diagnosis.
description_html: Info about child's symptoms and diagnosis.

description_long: Description of components of TF-CBT, session structure, treatment length
description_html: Description of components of TF-CBT, session structure, treatment length

description_long: Engaged family (e.g., found out what child liked, what motivates the family, etc.)
description_html: Engaged family (e.g., found out what child liked, what motivates the family, etc.)

description_long: P: Therapist provided parenting skills (e.g., praise, selective attention, time out, bx mng plans); ask parent about their reactions to the child's traumatic experience
description_html:
P: Therapist provided parenting skills (e.g., praise, selective attention, time out, bx
mng plans); ask parent about their reactions to the child's traumatic experience

description_long: R: Therapist explained the physiology of relaxation and rationale for relaxation techniques; instructed on methods of relaxation
description_html:
R: Therapist explained the physiology of relaxation and rationale for relaxation
techniques; instructed on methods of relaxation

description_long: Discuss ways that relaxation skills can help child with trauma reactions (GE); suggest that child use relaxation skills when they have trauma reminders
description_html:
Discuss ways that relaxation skills can help child with trauma reactions (GE);
suggest that child use relaxation skills when they have trauma reminders

description_long: A: Therapist assisted child in accurately identifying their feelings, and various ways of regulating their emotions (e.g., imagery, thought stopping, positive self-talk)
description_html:
A: Therapist assisted child in accurately identifying their feelings, and various ways of
regulating their emotions (e.g., imagery, thought stopping, positive self-talk)

description_long: Accurately identify and express a variety of feelings (positive and negative, in youth's words) (e.g. feelings brainstorm, Color My World, etc.)
description_html:
Accurately identify and express a variety of feelings (positive and negative, in
youth's words) (e.g. feelings brainstorm, Color My World, etc.)

description_long: Link feelings to situations, body and facial expressions
description_html: Link feelings to situations, body and facial expressions

description_long: Teach how to rate intensity levels of emotions (e.g. SUDS, feeling thermometer)
description_html: Teach how to rate intensity levels of emotions (e.g. SUDS, feeling thermometer)

description_long: Teach skills of managing emotions and difficult affective states (e.g. positive self-talk, enhancing child's sense of safety, etc.)
description_html:
Teach skills of managing emotions and difficult affective states (e.g. positive self-
talk, enhancing child's sense of safety, etc.)

description_long: Teach skills to identify/cope with array of feelings associated with trauma (GE)
description_html: Teach skills to identify/cope with array of feelings associated with trauma (GE)

description_long: C: Therapist reviewed skill of cognitive coping
description_html: C: Therapist reviewed skill of cognitive coping

description_long: Educate child on the distinction and relationship between thoughts, feelings and actions (e.g. acknowledge internal dialogues; introduce cognitive triangle)
description_html:
Educate child on the distinction and relationship between thoughts, feelings and
actions (e.g. acknowledge internal dialogues; introduce cognitive triangle)

description_long: Help the child generate alternative thoughts that are more accurate or helpful, in order to feel differently; discuss how to apply to real life
description_html:
Help the child generate alternative thoughts that are more accurate or helpful, in
order to feel differently; discuss how to apply to real life

description_long: T: Therapist worked on a trauma narrative (TN) the child (GE)
description_html: T: Therapist worked on a trauma narrative (TN) the child (GE)

description_long: Introduce rationale for TN; initiate TN (e.g. title page, timeline/table of contents)
description_html: Introduce rationale for TN; initiate TN (e.g. title page, timeline/table of contents)

description_long: Encourage child, in calibrated increments, to include more details of trauma
description_html: Encourage child, in calibrated increments, to include more details of trauma

description_long: Re-read the TN at the beginning of each session (GE)
description_html: Re-read the TN at the beginning of each session (GE)

description_long: Ask about and add in thoughts and feelings throughout the TN
description_html: Ask about and add in thoughts and feelings throughout the TN

description_long: Include worst memory/worst moment
description_html: Include worst memory/worst moment

description_long: Use cognitive processing techniques to modify distortions throughout the TN
description_html: Use cognitive processing techniques to modify distortions throughout the TN

description_long: Include piece on making meaning (e.g. what they've learned, how they grew)
description_html: Include piece on making meaning (e.g. what they've learned, how they grew)

description_long: As TN develops, read each new draft to supportive caregiver in collateral sessions
description_html: As TN develops, read each new draft to supportive caregiver in collateral sessions

description_long: I: Therapist developed in-vivo desensitization plan for generalized avoidant behaviors
description_html: I: Therapist developed in-vivo desensitization plan for generalized avoidant behaviors

description_long: C: Conjoint child-parent session: sharing trauma narrative with parent/caregiver
description_html: C: Conjoint child-parent session: sharing trauma narrative with parent/caregiver

description_long: Prepare caregiver and child separately for joint session in which TN is shared
description_html: Prepare caregiver and child separately for joint session in which TN is shared

description_long: Hold joint session (e.g., re-read TN, model praise, discuss questions prepared by both child and caregiver, praise and celebrate progress made)
description_html:
Hold joint session (e.g., re-read TN, model praise, discuss questions prepared by
both child and caregiver, praise and celebrate progress made)

description_long: E: Therapist addressed child's sense of safety (e.g. safety skills and safety plan)
description_html: E: Therapist addressed child's sense of safety (e.g. safety skills and safety plan)

description_long: Teach personal safety skills and assertive communication; increase awareness
description_html: Teach personal safety skills and assertive communication; increase awareness

description_long: Teach problem-solving skills and/or social skills as needed by the child
description_html: Teach problem-solving skills and/or social skills as needed by the child
